summary: A "private bank" refers to a financial institution that primarily serves high-net-worth individuals and offers personalized banking services, investment management, and wealth planning. Within the EU regulatory framework, private banks are subject to stringent compliance measures under directives such as the Capital Requirements Directive (CRD) and the Anti-Money Laundering Directive (AMLD). These institutions play a crucial role in the financial ecosystem by facilitating capital flow and investment opportunities while adhering to regulations that ensure transparency and risk management. The regulatory oversight aims to maintain financial stability and protect clients' interests in the private banking sector.
